title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, February 27, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife and expresses his unhappiness at being separated from his family. He discusses his pending resignation, and revives the idea of the family moving to Staunton. He complains that he does not receive enough letters from home.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
